summary: Life of Captain Marvel #1 Launch Trailer
title: Life of Captain Marvel #1 Launch Trailer
body:
Carol Danvers has been involved in some of the biggest adventures in the Marvel Universe…but in her new series, she’s going back to the basics with Margaret Stohl, Carlos Pacheco, and Marguerite Sauvage at the helm.

Marvel is proud to present this behind-the-scenes look at THE LIFE OF CAPTAIN MARVEL #1, featuring Stohl and Editor-in-Chief C.B. Cebulski!

“This is a story about Carol Danvers. We’re taking Carol back to basics,” said Cebulski. “We hear that a lot, but this is something where we’re going to dance between the raindrops and find the secrets of Carol’s origins that are based in the roots of her family.”

“It’s really a family story and it’s as much about the human instead of her as her Kree powers,” added Stohl.

Don’t miss THE LIFE OF CAPTAIN MARVEL #1, on sale now in comic shops, on the Marvel Comics App, and on Marvel.com! To find a comic shop near you, visit www.comicshoplocator.com or call 1-888-comicbook.

blog.name: thisiscomics
blog.title: A Panel A Day (more or less)
blog.description: I probably read too many comics. Here are some highlights. If you like, go give money to the creators.

summary: There are major problems for cat owners going into space. First of all, you can’t get a cat-sitter. Possibly because you, or the...
caption:
There are major problems for cat owners going into space.

First of all, you can’t get a cat-sitter. Possibly because you, or the cat, have pissed off any potential candidates.

Secondly, you need to keep the cat safe. In space.

Thirdly, you find out Rocket doesn’t like cats. Just as he is not a raccoon, he is a firm believer that Chewie is not a cat. And, as it’s Rocket, guns are necessary to express this belief.

I just loved the idea of Carol taking her cat with her- running away from home but taking a part of it with her, and then having to scoop Chewie into a cat box if there was any danger of space battles. It was just a neat little touch, helped by the fact that Chewie is cute.

Then to bring Rocket into the mix just ups the comedy factor of this situation perfectly. Trying to stop a wise ass, trigger happy Guardian of the Galaxy from wreaking havoc is not easy, but pretty damn funny. A cat avoiding blaster fire, resulting in damage to the ship, is reminiscent of an old cartoon- a strangely reversed Tom and Jerry perhaps, where it’s the rodent’s turn to completely fail in his hunt and leave carnage in his wake whilst his feline prey manages to shrug off all he has to offer.

This could truly be the start of a beautiful relationship…..

From Captain Marvel 2, by Kelly Sue DeConnick, David López, Lee Loughridge & Joe Caramagna

summary: “You screwed up, Avengers. That's human. What is also human is the ability to learn from those mistakes. To grow. To mature. If...
body:
“You screwed up, Avengers. That’s human. What is also human is the ability to learn from those mistakes. To grow. To mature. If you do that – even a little – then perhaps what I went through will have a positive meaning. It’s your choice” -Captain Marvel Earth-616 aka Carol Danvers (soon to be portrayed by Brie Larson)

{if you’re seeing this post give me a follow! I post aesthetics of a bunch of different marvel characters!}

summary:
Coverage of SDCC 2018 from the outside….Way outside! (Part 2 – Marvel)

Marvel Studios skipped SDCC when it comes to major...
caption:
Coverage of SDCC 2018 from the outside….Way outside! (Part 2 – Marvel)

Marvel Studios skipped SDCC when it comes to major ground breaking movie announcements but that doesn’t mean Marvel Comics or the other related properties went unspoken with announcements of their own. Marvel Studios skipping the famous Hall H of SDCC isn’t really as big a deal as some people would make it out to be.
